Hi, I’m SarahMay

I'm a puzzle solver. One of my favorite activities is sitting down with a crossword, sudoku, or yes, a Wordle, and feeling the mental exercise of a challenge. That instinct is what drew me to software engineering, where puzzles and problems to solve abound.

I enjoy the challenge of learning new tools, systems, and languages, constantly improving on legacy codebases, and developing projects that push my skills in new directions.

I have experience in frontend and UX/UI development using HTML, CSS, SASS, Bootstrap, JavaScript, Jekyll, and Shopify's Ruby-based Liquid template language. I’m inspired by clean design and user experiences, and my goal is to build websites, systems, and products that are functional, thoughtfully designed, and user-friendly.

Experience

Shopify Developer | Frontend and eCommerce

Bowtie (2022 – Present)

  • Develop, configure, and style Shopify themes and Jekyll websites using Liquid, JavaScript, Bootstrap, HTML5, CSS and SCSS
  • Implement frontend styles on 30+ client websites, with a strong eye toward clean design and user experiences
  • Maintain agile practices with trackers, transparency, pairing, and productivity tools such as Pivotal, Asana, Trello, and TopTracker
  • Develop new pages, features, and sites out of designs from Sketch, Figma, Zeplin
  • Ship clean, readable code, using Git best practices for version control
Assistant Director | Website Operations and eCommerce

Workman Publishing (2017 – 2022)

  • Oversee 20+ websites on a mixture of WordPress, Craft, & static pages hosted in AWS S3
  • Supervise infrastructure re-architecture projects, and relaunches for author & brand websites
  • Technical lead for frontend eCommerce and UI/UX development, using HTML, CSS and Shopify’s Ruby-based template language, Liquid
  • Analyze and report on website, eCommerce, & newsletter analytics to inform business strategy
  • Participate as a lead member of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion Committee, 4 subcommittees
Member | Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Committee

Workman Publishing (2020 – 2022)

  • Participate as a lead member of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion oversight committee
  • Developed company mission statement
  • Launched, directed, and co-wrote the Workman DEI newsletter
  • Created Read With Pride landing page, merchandising plan, and successfully advocated to have leadership read a written statement honoring Pride Month in June 2021
Principal Draftsperson

Epstein Engineering P.C. (2014 – 2017)

  • Developed technical drawings of residential and commercial buildings using AutoCAD
  • Filed plans and engineering reports with government agencies
